Row.Text: Welcome to China. I hope you find your stay to be enjoyable.
I am Deng Xiaoping, Paramount Leader of China. Who might you be?
I see. Perhaps I was too rash.
China is not the weak nation it once was. You have made a terrible mistake.
We have much to learn from each other. Shall we make a Declaration of Friendship?

So long as it can catch mice, a black cat and a white cat are both useful. You, however, cannot even catch mice.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
You have done nothing to deserve the trust I placed in you.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
That things had to come to this is unfortunate, but you leave me no choice.
Watch yourself. These lands belong to China, and I intend to keep it that way.
Your nation offers nothing of value.
Hello. What brings you here today?
It is good to see you. Here, have some tea.
Your armies scurry like rats on our borders. How long will you hide in the shadows?
An exchange would help our nations grow closer.
We have much to learn from each other. Perhaps if we open our borders, we may both gain much.
Your continued attempts at spreading your borders are becoming concerning. I urge you to stop.
China needs your help, my friend.
You have declared yourself an enemy of the Han people.
You have not proved yourself to be worthy of China's friendship.
This war is far from finished.
